123232.content:
Hansel had been the first to notice the change over the past couple of weeks when he could no longer get his shirt to cover his stomach. In fact, as he looked around the room, he noticed that many of the other kids were struggling with tight clothes. The witch had already predicted that this would be the outcome after a couple of weeks, and this was quite the joy to her. Of course, what made her the happiest was all the nice, round potbellies they had all started to develop. No surprise there. They had all been stuffing themselves like Christmas geese, and it was, of course, inevitable that they have the round stomachs to prove it.

However, each had had the rest of the weight spread out differently for them. The twins were practically bowling balls. They were pretty much nothing but belly. Gretel and Suzi were both on their way to a spherical shape. Everything seemed to spread out evenly for them from their thick thighs and bottoms, to their juicy round cheeks. Ellie was more on the top-heavy side, having larger breasts to compliment her belly. Hansel had a very even spread, but he was tallest, and it made him look a little thinner. Cindy was practically all hips, accentuating her maternal figure. She was becoming a real Venus of Willendorf that one. And Martha was a rather perfect pear.

The witch was practically drooling looking at all of them. Another six months of this, and they would all be ready for the barn. She had to maintain composure though. "Oh, it looks like you need some new clothes," she cooed. "Just as well. You really do need something nicer than those old rags anyway. Come over here, and I'll get you all measured."

Oh yes, they were indeed coming along nicely, she thought as she measured each of them, making sure to "accidentally" grab and pinch them a couple of times. Or, most of them anyway. With Ellie's greed, she would be ready much sooner than all the others. She would just "happen" to disappear one night. Gretel, Suzi, and the twins were not that hard to get to eat. They were much too dumb to know any better. They would fatten right on schedule. It was Hansel, Cindy, and Martha who would be the trouble. They were older, and therefore more suspicious. They were not eating nearly as much as the rest. It would take a lot of coaxing to get them on the same pacing as the others.

Now would come a lot of the hard parts. She would slowly have to increase the amount they ate every day, making sure they did not notice. She would also have to become a little more forceful as well, getting them to eat well past being full so that their stomachs would stretch properly. That was the only way to make sure they ate enough to get fat enough on schedule. Right now, though, she had quite a bit of time. She had only just harvested that 600 pound hog last night, and the meat would last her for quite some time. She had eaten a small roast last night and stored the rest in her smokehouse, hidden in the back of her yard. Plus, she had four others in the barn to give her a well-stocked larder before then. The hardest part was making sure all of them had at least thirty minutes of walking exercise each day. That helped them support their new weight with a little muscle. It also helped to create that well-marbled meat that practically fell off the bone and was so sweet. After two weeks of nothing but eating and sleeping, they would be a little lethargic, and it would take some convincing. She would start them out today, and lure them with the prospect of a large picnic to get them to walk.

She just finished measuring Gretel, gave her a quick pat on the stomach and told her to go finish breakfast while she got the picnic ready.

"Mommy i'm hungry!" A voice suddenly screamed.

"Oh that's my daughter. Would you like to meet her?"

"Eh... sure."

Slowly they walked to room with a big door. The women opened the door and on a huge bed Cindy saw a huge girl. Seeing her face with two big bowl pink cheeks she seemed pretty and young. Even younger then Cinderella. This girl was still a kid. Her arms looked like pillows. she was't able to bend them. Her neck was gone and melted to her chest. Her legs and thighs were huge balls of fat her feet buried in them. Her belly was the biggest with two big rolls and big boobs that if the girl would't be fat would't be so big also. But the girl had a big smile on her fat face. She seemed happy when she saw her mother with the food.
Cinderella understood why the girl did't want to get up. She was even fatter then her. She got the strange feeling she had seen the girl before. But she did't remember where.

"Who is that girl mommy?" The girl asked while her mother tied a napkin around her neck.

"This is Cinderella. A big girl just like you."

"How... how did you get so big?"

"Well..." Her mother started. "My daughter was a little sweet tooth since she was born and had a good appetite. She was maybe a bit chubby or plump but not too much. My man and i want a vacation. A long vacation and in the meantime a spinster wanted to take care of her. I told her she had a big appetite and that she need to feed her. When we came back we found out that she did feed her good."

"Best day's of my life." The girl mumbled."So much good food the whole time."

"Of course this is't what i mend but well the most important thing is that my daughter is happy."

"She is?"

"As long if i get food."

"A spinster did this to her? Now i know where i saw you before. On one of her DVD's. She had fattened up girls before. Your one of them!"

"You know her?" The mother asked.

"I do! My stepmother asked her to fatten me up. Well she first asked a man but later she asked the spinster. Most of this fat is thanks to her."

"Oh poor girl. So she forced you to become fat? But why?"

"So my stepmother could get my money."

Suddenly she heard someone come in. It was a big man. about 80 inches long with big shoulders and very muscled with muscled arms but with a nice friendly face.

"Oh hello. I did't knew we had a guest."

"That's my dad." The girl answered.

"She is another victim of that spinster." Her mother said.

"THAT BITCH!" In his anger the man hit the wall so hard that there was a hole in it.

"Honey control your anger or else you wreck the house."

"Yes of course. Sorry honey. Sorry for you too girl. I'm normally not like that. Normally i'm very friendly and calm."

"Come here and eat with us. Don't worry we won't let that spinster take you back."

Cinderella walked back too the table and eat a big dinner with the parents of the girl.
141111112122111112121.title: The obese girl

choices: The Spinster and the Stepmother enjoy making Cinderella morbidly obese
1411111121221111121211.content:
The Spinster knew she had to find Cindy. Besides, she knew she had made Cindy addicted to her pastries and cakes. She well knew that Cindy could not resist the scent of her food.
After a while, the Spinster found out where Cinderella was.
But she could not get in the house and get her. The man would kill her.
So, she waited for the couple to leave the house. And then, she let the scent of her pastries and cakes invade the house. Cinderella was reading a book, but suddenly indentified the scent. A great fear invaded her. She tried to scream, to resist, to stay where she was. But it was too strong an impulse. With a big effort she stood up. She tried to identify where the scent was coming from. It clearly came from outside the house. Cindy walked to the door and opened it. Where was the scent coming from?. It was driving her crazy. She needed those pastries and cakes!. Right now she could think of nothing else. She had to find where the scent was coming from. And then, she saw it. A small and quaint cottage, not very far from the house. She could swear it had not been there yesterday, but well, if those cakes were there, that was all that right now mattered.
She walked slowly to the cottage (after all, she weighed 510 lbs), with her mouth wattering. The door was ajar, and there were a couple of steps. With effort she climbed the steps, and opened the door.
It was a single room cottage. There was a table, covered with cakes and pastries, a big chair, a fork and a knife. A flash of fear froze Cinderella. She knew the Spinster had to be behind this. She tried to turn around. But her addiction to the food this woman cook was too strong. With tears running down her cheek, she sat at the table, and began to eat. She eat cake after cake, and pastry after pastry. When there was nothing left, she felt asleep. The spinster had put a powerful sleeping powder in her cakes.
The door was shut from the outside, and there was a click.
The cottage turned out not to be a cottage, but a horse-drawn caravan disguised as one.
With the Spinster at the reins, the caravan began moving. Inside the caravan, an sleeping Cinderella was being taken back to her bed in the basement, where a furious Stepmother was waiting for her.
When Cinderella woke up, she was in the basement, in the Stepmother house. Again, she had been handcuffed to the bed.
Standing by the bed were the Stepmother and the Spinster.
The Stepmother said: "It looks as if our little gazelle here has been roaming the countryside as of late. Well Spinster, we'll take measures to make this beautifull gazelle a more domesticated animal." She grabbed and caressed Cinderella's belly with both hands. "See spinster, you -with whatever help you need- are to turn this rather smallish belly, into a 1000 lbs mass of jiggling fat that will convince this gazelle here to behave". Cinderella was sobbing.
"Make her eat. I want to see her eating. This was the last time this girl left this bed. I want her so fat, that she we'll need my help to raise her hand".
Then she got her face close to Cinderella's. "Now beauty, I leave you with the Spinster. Fat and food will be your great comforts and companions from now on. Enjoy them".

Indeed, it seemed that the original inhabitants of this house had been very careless with their breakfast. It seemed an entire feast had been laid out. Porridge, eggs, bacon, potatoes, a small mountain of pancakes. Everything she could possibly want was there.

Goldilocks wasted no time sitting down and digging into the meal. She was not a very considerate girl and didn't particularly care that she was not only invading someone else's home or eating their food. She started by taking a little of everything and ravenously ate.

All the while, she didn't notice the family of bears watching her eat through the window. The three bears may have been good cooks, but their efforts were all used towards getting their absolute favorite food: fresh meat. Papa and Mama cooked and baked to lure in greedy and hungry humans, which they would later serve on their own table.

Of course, like all their best meals, they needed fattening up. After all, they deserved it. These were greedy and selfish people anyway who would've just broken into someone else's home and eaten them out of house and home.

Mama and Papa watched with glee as Goldilocks ate more and more of their spread. She would make a fine meal indeed. She ate without a care in the world. She would be easy to fatten up.

By now, Goldilock's pace had slowed. That, or she was starting to run out of food on the table. Still, she had managed to stuff herself pretty well. After cleaning the last plate, she sat back and rubbed her swollen middle. Whoever lived here, they sure could cook, she thought.

But after a meal like that, Goldilocks started to feel pretty tired, and she got up looking for a place to rest. Like a stuffed, Christmas goose, Goldilocks waddled about, looking for a comfortable place to lay down.

At first, she found several chairs in the living room. At first she tried the biggest one, but it was far too hard. The second one was soft, but a little too soft. She sunk right in. The littlest chair felt fairly right to her. It was a bit of a tight squeeze with her belly full. It seemed like this would work, until she heard a horrible creaking sound coming from the chair. Instantly, it broke underneath her.

Well, that was a bit of a setback, she thought. Struggling to get to her feet, Goldilocks decided to try the bedrooms. She wanted to take a nap anyway.

Upon entering the bedroom, she found three beds. She already knew the outcome if she tried the first two. She went to the little bed first. She tried it cautiously, making sure it too did not suffer the same fate as the chair. This bed seemed sturdier and she laid back in it to sleep off her food coma.

155232222.content:
Gabrielle was a large girl with very small feet, and she lived in a town, in a nation, in a time, where to be a large woman with small feet was to be loved. Her father, the duke, fed her on bonbons, eclairs, strawberries, cream, and real bread and butter, and until she reached the age of thirteen, he had every right to believe that, because of her beauty, she would attract many handsome prospects when it came time for him to give her away. Wishing for the girl to have an example of feminine grace (her own gentle mother had died some years before), he married the widow of a local landowner and brought her and her three scrawny daughters into the house he and his dear Gabrielle had inhabited in times of happiness and plenty. Then he died.

I shall not pretend that his death was due to foul play by the house's new inhabitants, for there is no reason not to believe that the duke's new wife did not love him. She was temperamental and often jealous, especially of the attention he lavished on his little Gabrielle, and she told him more than once that he was spoiling the girl with the sweets and dresses he lavished on her. Moreover, whatever the local peasants might have whispered, the duke died not of poison but disease--a wasting disease which Gabrielle's stepmother also contracted and survived, though at great cost to her once-notable beauty. She quickly grew rail-thin and hollow-eyed, and she now truly looked like an old woman. And so, with the death of her husband and little chance left her of gaining a new one, she turned her attention on the advancement of her own daughters, who became, in effect, the real mistresses of Gabrielle's house. And because girls with straw-colored and mouse-brown hair often envy another her thick golden curls, and because women with little softness to their features frequently dislike a large-eyed, round-cheeked, light-skinned beauty, and because ladies whose figures are chiseled like rocks or knotty and lean like trees are maddened by a mademoiselle whose flesh rolls like the salt ocean, fruitful, stormy and alluring, Gabrielle was often mistreated by her new and older sisters.

By now, I am sure, you have guessed what story we are revisiting. For this reason, I would like to make one thing clear. Gabrielle was never forced by her step-family to lift a finger or do a single day's work. Such a thing would hardly have been tolerated by any of the late duke's connections, or even by any of the peasantry. Again, let me say, they never forced her to work or assume a subordinate position of any kind. Instead, her sisters teased her into it. It began with a simple nickname, given to her by the stepsister nearest her own age, with a nose like a rat. The two were fighting over a bauble that had been Gabrielle's--the one sister greasy and bristle-haired with a nose like a rat's, and Gabrielle tossing her curls and becoming visibly discomposed--though she never shouted. When the step-sister knew she couldn't wrestle the plaything from the supple hands of her rival, she resorted to name-calling:

"You--you--Graissielle!" she shouted. "Give it to me now!"

Gabrielle released the bauble at once, so suddenly that her ratty sister fell out of her chair. Yet it was Gabrielle who was stunned. She knew she was, indeed, graisse--plump--but what shocked her was hearing that her sister mock her because of an attribute that everyone always implied enhanced her considerable beauty. "Ah, how graisse you are growing, my little one!" her uncles would always say when they made their visits. "Becoming quite the little woman! You will make quite a match for some young man--that is certain!" they would always add, which made her--fourteen, and only recently woman--blush prettily and look down. But here, her sister used the term--graisse--not to flatter her, but rather insult her. She felt something quite new when the name "Graissielle" was given to her, and in her confusion she became quiet.

Do not think this was lost on the other sisters. This new name--Graissielle--seemed to put their little sister in her place--to make her acquiescent, humble, and eager-to-please. It was a mystery to them, as well, why a word once used to compliment their sister--a compliment that any of them would have blushed and smiled to receive--should make her so intensely self-conscious. But it did. And they took advantage of this new power to degrade their pretty little sister further. Whenever the girl was wearing a dress that looked particularly fetching or opulent, they would say something cunning--not quite out of the range of her hearing--like, "Oh, there goes that little Grassielle. Quite the little lady in her great, fluffy gown! Shall we go and wait on her, sisters?" And the next day, they would notice, little Gabrielle would wear something much plainer. Likewise, for a period of time, they called her "Grassielle Gold-head! Grassielle Gold-head!" until one day, in exasperation, she begged them to cut her beautiful tresses off, then wept as they did so. Seeing, later, that despite her terrible haircut she was still more beautiful than they, and still nevertheless desperate for their approval, they also took to saying things like, "Well, we'd better sweep the house, I suppose--if we wait for lazy little Miss Grassielle to do it, we will be tripping over dustballs and cobwebs before long," They enjoyed pretending to always be working harder than their sister who, in order to attempt to compensate for her apparent laziness, began sweeping floors, cleaning chimneys, washing dishes, making (but not eating) food, and even chopping wood and cleaning stables. Gabrielle's stepmother, meanwhile, pretended lamely to discipline her girls, but secretly she was glad that little Gabrielle would at least be a little less spoiled for having grown up with her own children.

By her fifteenth birthday, to the delight of her stepsisters, Gabrielle was almost unrecognizable. Her once-plump figure had dwindled to the point where--though still big-boned--it was almost as gaunt as that of the other women of the house. Her hair was cut short (so as not to interfere with her work) and filthy. Her opulent dresses no longer fit her, and she had to borrow clothes either from her sisters or the servants, as her stepmother refused to buy her new ones. Only her face retained some beauty, though the softness of her chin and the plumpness of her cheeks were gone. People living nearby no longer even recognized her as the daughter of their once-beloved duke, and they called her Cinderelle--"Cinder-girl," a name which her sisters began using as well, once "Grassielle," like the girl's dresses, no longer fit her. As for the name "Gabrielle," it was forgotten by everyone. Or, at least, almost everyone. But there was a woman, who had once been a friend of the duke, and who had been present at Gabrielle's christening despite a conflicted feelings about entering churches. This woman lived far off in the woods, in a tiny thatch cottage and some held that she was a holy woman, and others insisted she was a witch. Yet she was neither of these things, but rather one of the old ones called fay in Brittany. And, though Cinderelle did not know her, she was, of course, her godmother.

End Part I
